						                Data Science & Data Analytics
					



Data Analytics
Data Science
View All Certificate Programs




Earn CSUF Data Science & Data Analytics Certificates in 9 Months

					                Earn your Data Science & Data Analytics certificates in 9 months.  This program is ideal for a range of analysts, senior managers, marketing strategists, engineers, scientists and graduates who wish to enter the data science and data analytics field.
				







Data Science



Length: 9 months
Cost: $4,230*
Location: Online








Data Analytics



Length: 9 months
Cost: $4,230*
Location: Online








* Cost is approximate and subject to change

Interview with Kevin Potcner, Lead Instructor and Statistical Scientist at JMP/SAS

						                In this Q&A, Kevin talks about the benefits of online learning, common career paths for program graduates, and what it takes to be successful in the program.
					
Read Interview





Meet  Efunwande Osoba, Lead Instructor for Data Science
Read Bio








x
Meet our lead instructor: Efunwande Osoba




Efunwande Osoba 
						               Lead Instructor
					

						                Efunwande Osoba is a research physicist turned data scientist. In a past life, she was interested in how novel particles like sterile neutrinos could explain the mystery of dark matter. Nowadays, she works with all things data to demystify business needs. Currently she is a senior data scientist at Formation, working on reinforcement learning strategies in the marketing tech space. She has broad experience in quantitative analysis and building predictive models. Efunwande has been developing courses and teaching for Data Science & Data Analytics program at CSUF since its launch in 2015.
					







What's Your Next Step?

					                Learn how to successfully take courses online or join our email list. By joining our email list, we will send you important program updates.

Non-California Residents

					                Due to state and federal regulations, non-California residents may only enroll in CSUF online courses when their state has authorized CSUF as a provider. You can learn more about online program eligibility on the  State Regulations page.
